website_summaries.verdict: These headphones are designed for professional use, so it's no surprise that they offer excellent sound quality and maximum comfort.
pros: Rich, crisp sound quality doesn't overdo the bass
Extra long 10-foot cord gives you freedom to move
Designed for use in recording studios
cons: Some feel the cable is too long and is easy to trip over or get tangled in

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Even with the volume maxed out on my phone, the audio through the headphones is only just barely audible. I have to strain to hear words and can't really drown out external noise with music, which is what I bought these for. Also, the bass is almost nonexistent and they sound very tinny. I have $10 earbuds I like better than these stupid things. Won't be buying from this company ever again.
customer_reviews.author: VenaKava

customer_reviews.title: The headphones work great - if you're deaf in one ear
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones so i could play my bass without disturbing people and to play games with (since i already have a standalone mic i don't need an extra one on the headphones). I opened the box once I got them and i only ever heard anything out of the left ear speaker. I tried music on youtube and I tried plugging it into my bass and my amp output jack - nothing from the right ear. There aren't even any buttons, according to the instructions manual. Will be returning these immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible pair of headphones. Do not buy if you are an a person with a normal size set of ears. These things suck. I have been trying to wear them for audio work and gaming. They hurt so bad and I wish i never bought them. I literally feel the pulse in the side of my head because of how squashed I feel RETURNING IMMEDIATLY
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Almost pro quality for a budget price
customer_reviews.text: I love Audio-Technica products. I've had a pair of M50s for 10 years and have been extremely happy with them. After getting tired of buying cheap headphones for my daughters every few months (because they'd break), I was looking at getting something better. For the price, these are incredible. No, they're not as good as my M50s. But they're also a third the price. If you want a really good pair of headphones but aren't quite ready to buy pro quality stuff at pro prices, these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stimpson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After A Month
customer_reviews.text: These headphones seemed to work really well and seemed very durable. But after about a month of using them lightly, one ear started failing, giving me a really unbalanced sound when I used them. It's very upsetting as I can't return them now and so now I have an essentially new pair of headphones that don't work.
customer_reviews.author: John Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Over 3 1/2 years and going strong.
customer_reviews.text: Was checking my old purchases and came across these head phones. Bought these in Dec 2016 for $29.00 to use for silent guitar practice with my amp and for listening to music on my pc, they have been used and continue to be used everyday moving them from one to the other, sometimes by reaching over and pulling them from the phone jack from 3 feet away ( NOT RECOMMENDED.) and they still look and sound just like the day they were new. great sound quality, durability off the chart and comfy. Would buy again at 49 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: RandyChips

customer_reviews.title: good studio headphones, good for recording, not much bass for casual listening.
customer_reviews.text: it serves it's purpose for recording vocals, clear highs good mids, very little bass. I don't mind though cause the bass is played off the sound system, just isn't that great for doubling up as everyday hi fi headphones, sounds a little on the tinny side. comfortable for the most part and price range. the real good stuff goes from 100-300 dollars which is too much for me right now, but these do the job well until next level evolution.
customer_reviews.author: Halfrotech

customer_reviews.title: This is the ear comfort we hoped for!  Excellent value for the money, too!
customer_reviews.text: These have the larger, oval ear openings that fit completely over the ear (instead of the usual round ones that crush the top of the ear, especially). The sound is good, the noise cancellation is good, volume control is good. they're the most comfortable ear phones I've ever worn. The price is surprisingly reasonable for the quality. Overall, I'm really glad we bought these! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: C. R. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor sound quality, I have bought 20$ off-brand walmart headphones with a clearer and richer sound
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT pair of headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional bassist, for over 50 years now. yeah, I'm old. After literally tens of thousands of gigs, rehearsals and practicing at home, I have incurred some hearing damage. I'm lucky, I have retained a lot more than some of my friends who have been in the business as long. I also have plenty of session experience, where the headphones varied from worn out to new ones, in all types. Some were seriously expensive, audiophile pairs. These Audio Technica phones are excellent quality. Especially for the money. They have really good high frequency detail, and tight clean bass. Another important thing, is that they are really comfortable. to wear. I highly recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: LHBassist

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality and build quality is perfect for my home recording studio
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality and build quality is perfect for my home recording studio. My only complaint is that the right ear pad is much smaller than the left, making the right headphone seem like an on ear rather than over ear...not very comfortable. I ordered 2 sets and both had identical flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Erik

customer_reviews.title: WOW REALLY GREAT SOUND FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: Well I am 66 yrs old use to using an old set of head phones, they were stereo but from the 90'S, and they worked, order these based on reviews and for my little portable cd player all I can say is WOW.. Fits good, does not hurt my ears, as a matter of fact fell asleep listing to my christian music with them on. Could not hear any back ground noise when playing my music ... For me they work really good could not ask for anything better. Thank you I love this headset, and fast shipping too.
customer_reviews.author: AHAA

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sound & Comfortable for Hours
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for working at home during the COVID-19 quarantine. The noise-canceling technology works perfectly; I hear very little outside noise even though we have three kids (two of whom are toddlers) in the house, one room over. These are very comfortable for most of the day. I wear glasses, and around the 8-hour mark I start to feel discomfort/pressure where the headphones push on the earpieces of the glasses. But that is only after many hours, because these are comfortable the rest of the day. I highly recommend these, especially at their very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lake

customer_reviews.title: These are VERY accurate, especially for the $.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an accurate headset without $$. I've known Audio-Technica since the late 70s. My friend (the late Bob Cadway) visited me in ABQ. We were playing in my studio and showed him this nice low-cost condenser mic and he took one to NY. He was recording Mariah Carey and he put the Audio-Technica next to a Neumann U-87 for her vocals. After the session, he asked the producers and others which vocal track they liked and the Audio-Technica won! ROFL. Great stuff. The only issue with this headset is some pressure on your head. I spent several hours with it and it was fine. My head is not particularly wide, so......
customer_reviews.author: Douglas P. Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Budget-Friendly Studio Headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use these for recording and mixing/mastering and yeah iI can hear certain notes for EQ that I wouldn’t be able to hear from a studio monitor. I’m going to telll you though that if you already have a studio headphone, just stick with it and not purchase these since it feels really cheap like the ones you get for free in like microphone packs and stuff. I’d invest in the ATH-50x instead. However, if you don’t have the money or don’t have any studio headphones, these will do for the short run
customer_reviews.author: kyung

customer_reviews.title: Hurts if you have big ears or head. But great sound.
customer_reviews.text: I had to edit this.. I complained a bit about the padding before. But the more you use this the worse it gets. If you got a big head or big ears be warned. These start to hurt very quickly. I ended up swapping the ear pads out with old ear pads from different brand and it was kinda sad just so shoddy the pads were in this thing. It's basically this rough riggid plastic foe leather that's half deflated. I compared that to the soft pads I put in them... It's just no contest. These things fail on comfort. Which is really sad. I love the sound but I just can't wear these things without being in pain.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Very good headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using ear buds or sometimes a headset because I thought headphones would be too heavy, too hot and too uncomfortable. These are not. They're very comfortable and the sound is better than anything else I've tried. Even with a TV or vacuum cleaner running in the background I can still very clearly hear whatever I'm listening to. They're easy to adjust and the cord is quite long, good quality and doesn't tangle easily. There's a plug adapter included, and the piece that goes over your head is padded. I'm pleased with this purchase and recommend these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: I've had several pairs of these
customer_reviews.text: My parents bought me a pair of Audiotechnicas for christmas about 10 years ago now and since then they are the only headphone I buy. I've had 2 pairs of the ATH-M20x and a set of bluetooth over the ear ones and they have all been outstanding. I'm an average user that uses them in the office to listen to music or podcasts and they work phenomenally for that purpose. With almost daily use with several hours of listening, they both have lasted several years before they needed to be replaced. You cannot beat the value at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Redler

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy build, excellent sound.
customer_reviews.text: The materials and build quality feel fragile like Bose headsets. Thin, hollow plastic that a little kid could snap. The pleather is comfy enough but doesn't feel like it's meant to last (I've owned Sennheisers with identical material that fell apart after a year of regular use). That said, the sound quality has been very good. Songs that I've always thought were 'meh' now have a new life to them. I find that I'm able to hear various parts of music that I haven't been able to before. 5-star sound quality, minus 1 star for build quality. For $40 it's a good bargain. Higher model looks sturdier but costs more than twice as much..
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Good value, great sound!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are relatively inexpensive and work well. I wanted a pair that went over the ear, rather than just pressing onto the ear, and these are great. They also feature a single input cable rather than a split "Y" cable (with one cable going to each ear). The cable is rather long (must be 12 feet, at least) but I keep some of it coiled up. Very satisfied, overall.
customer_reviews.author: My review

customer_reviews.title: $50 bucks is too much for a highly lacking soundstage
customer_reviews.text: Got because the reviews seemed right for the price and looking for a good studio quality flat sound for mixing. Something about them just sounded off, a little tinny and just bad. Kinda like Shure mics vs Sennheiser mics, I feel like Audio Technica just doesn't have headphone game to compete with Beyerdynamic, Sony or other more dynamic sounding cans. Go on Monoprice and buy their $15 cans if you want something that will sound pretty similar to these.
customer_reviews.author: W.C.

customer_reviews.title: They sound great
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound great. They do not equal Bose (or comparable) sound but are still very good. I see a lot of reviews complaining about the 10ft cord. Remember these are monitor headphones for recording. Musicians with instruments strapped on them (guitars) or sitting behind them (drum set) need the extra length. They work great for what they are intended. I recommend them. Four stars only because they don't equal the quality sound of high-end headphones. But, remember these headphones are a fraction of the cost. And the sound is more than adequate for laying down tracks in a home studio.
customer_reviews.author: D. Frye

customer_reviews.title: Junk didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: Got these delivered Oct 29th. And they already have a short in the cord. These are only used at a desk and when I am recording music. Didn’t last no time. Junk. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect headphones for live monitoring and playback. We have been using these in our media booth at church for live monitoring for a few years with zero issues. Decided to upgrade my personal set for our own music gigs and I am more than satisfied with them. For budget headphones, you will not beat these. I am sure the ATH-M50X's are better if you want to spend the money there, but for solid pair of headphones with great sound quality yet and a smaller bill, these are the ones for you!
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN WHALEN

customer_reviews.title: Still comfortable after daily use for 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for my teenager's birthday and he hasn't taken them off since. He uses them at the computer and keyboard. Composing music or just playing games and watching YouTube. For the price and his heavy usage I'm satisfied. Because of the nature of their design they naturally provide some noise cancellation. This has been much appreciated for him as his siblings can be noisy at times and now he doesn't have to turn the volume up as high to drown them out. He's satisfied with the sound quality. It should be noted that he also wears glasses and this hasn't been an issue with comfort.
customer_reviews.author: NotSue

customer_reviews.title: beware bad design
customer_reviews.text: You see that collapsibility feature, to size the headphones to your head? See that wire that sticks out very clearly in the photo? Yeah, it doesn't go inside. Instead, it got crushed in two places by the sizer thing. Literally used these headphones like once and then they were ruined cause one ear doesnt work, where the wire got crushed. I left them at work and when I was able to go back post the covid shutdown, the return warranty passed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Quality isn't Studio... more like cheap earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones because of the good reviews, but was sorely disappointed. There is no active noise cancellation, and the pads don't reduce much noise either. The sound quality is worse than a pair of $30 earbuds. There is little to no bass or low tones. Overall, I will be doing much more research before I buy a pair of headphones. These are nothing like what the description cracks them up to be. This will be the lowest rating I've ever given a product I've bought... I was really sad about this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob K.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the headphone we purchasedwas good till it died after 8 months... The left ear was completely mute. In our case, the problem came from poor soldering and disconnection of the L wire in the male jack. I suspect similar root-cause in all the reviews stating muting or large L/R volume imbalance.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F.

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound  but not impressed with build quality.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like it immediately I opened the box, looks cheap compared to the MX-50 my late friend owned. I was impressed with the sound quality though but build quality was off for me. For the price I think there are better options. I wish the long cable was detachable, it would have made a whole lot of sense for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ebipabo Fred

customer_reviews.title: Easily one of the best purchases I've made for $50
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for gaming. Great build quality, no creaking plastics, and visually appealing (I prefer this design of fewer seams over the m50x). Humble with no frills, just a removable 6.35mm adapter that fits over the 3.5mm jack. Metal adjusters slide continuously rather than locking at specific points (like many headphones) creating a more precise fit on the head. Ear cups compressing inward can make glasses uncomfortable without some adjusting, but also make the fit secure and helps with noise cancellation. This might be the lowest tier of the M series, but easily the best quality headphones on the market for $50.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Great for listening loudly without disturbing others nearby
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for listening at my desk in my office. They're very comfortable, and they don't bleed much sound so they're perfect for listening at work or other places where you don't want to disturb others in the same room. The sound quality is very good, fairly neutral with a slight bass frequency boost. They can be driven well by a laptop or a smartphone (no headphone amp required). I prefer these over a pair of Sony studio monitor headphones that cost me 2x as much. I'm sure there are "better" headphones out there, but for the price these are great.
customer_reviews.author: J. VDE

customer_reviews.title: For the Price this is a great wired headphone
customer_reviews.text: For the price point the quality of the Audio-Technica ATH-M20x is great. I think it provides sufficient noise cancellation due to its over the ear design even though it is not a noise cancelling headphone. May not be comfortable for long usage but i think it is more of a subjective topic to assess. Great packaging and looks great quality out of box.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Johnson

customer_reviews.title: not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pair of headphones as a gift for her new gaming setup. She liked them at first, but over time the pressure from the metal band felt like a tight squeeze, so it's not meant to be worn for long periods of time. Sound quality is a little lackluster. Sound is good except the bass is overpowering the mids and highs. Could have been an amazing pair of headphones for $50, but I like to be comfortable wearing them while gaming and listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: E.T.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a little more than a month.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the headphone, however their build quality is poor. I ordered them on August 22nd and they already broke on October 7th. I only use them at my desk at work. They don't travel or go through any abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Toomer

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these out of curiosity. You know, a want more than a need. I've gone through a lot of audio accessories like in ear, on ear, over ear, wired and wireless. Have to say I was really surprised by just how good these are. Music comes through crisp and clear without hearing a lot of outside noise. Definitely recommend this. Lots of bang for the bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin  from  Austin, TX.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, rash from ear cups
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sound is good, fits nicely, easy to use, good for gaming and music, cable seems durable Preference: no volume control, cable is a bit long for close range Cons: internal earcups cause sweat within an hour, did not mention about material of earcups, i get dermatitis, or rashes, from wearing the pleather, "soft protein leather." Overall everything is good except for the sweating and earcup material. I will swap their fake leather to some rash-free fake leather to prevent the itching
customer_reviews.author: guy

customer_reviews.title: Professional Headphones
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!! These headphones are better than I originally expected. Excellent sound. I purchased used, but you would not know it except for the box front that was cut out. Even includes the larger male adapter. The ratings were right. You will not go wrong with these headphones. Why pay more for headphones when these at $40 used are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Bicycle

customer_reviews.title: Not too comfy
customer_reviews.text: I wear glasses so i get a little fatigue after about an hour and a half or so of gaming/streaming and/or song writing. It probably dont help that i also have a bigger head size and the ear cups could be just a little bit bigger and if you have just a little too much base they sound like complete trash. Other than that tho for 30 USD its a steal forsure. Quality of material is good, ive had my pair hit the floor countless times and they bend and adjust really well.
customer_reviews.author: xKhino.Twitch.tv

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones money can buy!! Definitely not lacking in the sound department
customer_reviews.text: Love these, the sound quality is amazing. The extra long cable is a must. It's not often that you can find headphones with this level of build quality, comfort & sound for less than 50 dollars. I use these headphones to edit my YouTube videos. I recommend these for anyone that working with either a big or small budget
customer_reviews.author: WooReviews

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality for the money, but...
customer_reviews.text: They are extremely uncomfortable after prolonged use. I wouldn't wear them for over 4 hours per session / day, as they don't conform to your ears. Because of this, my ears get swollen and I can't even keep the headphones on. Would not advise to buy for gaming, but if you run a studio setup - this is certainly a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing/recording!
customer_reviews.text: I’m just starting out recording and producing my own music, and I’m honestly pretty shook about how good these are. Keep in mind: these are not for noise cancelation. The sound is crisp and very clean, and so far has worked well with my recording projects. I love these! I can’t help but listen to Spotify with em too, they’re just good. I wasn’t expecting the quality to be this high but damn it really is. I’m happy the price was so low for what these are. The skull candy noise cancelling headphones were so awful for monitor headphones. These are perfect 👌🏻
customer_reviews.author: Ashley C.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable headphones I ever used. The most was 4x the price. I wear these 4 to 6 hours a day at work and my ears never once began to hurt. The cushioning is excellent and helps block a fair amount of room noise. The cord is really long. The sound quality is not the best, not very bright and not very bassy, but I am plugged into work computers which are not know to use high-end chipsets.
customer_reviews.author: Reuben

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Since the Covid quarantine I had been writing music and mixing from home. I have some cheap monitors that I use for general mixing and tracking, but wanted something that was more flat EQ wise. Read a lot of reviews and Sonarworks diagrams, and these are definitely the best headphones under $100. A little bit of compensation might be needed in the very high end range, but gives a very clear representation of the mix. For budget mixing/tracking headphones these are top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good for tracking
customer_reviews.text: Closed-back design so sound spillover during tracking in a studio is minimized. I think they sound good considering the low cost and, while not reliable for mixing, are good enough for a rough mix or making adjustments on the fly and represent the sound true enough that polished singers or musicians can hear themselves fairly true. I'll buy 4 more pairs for the studio when they go back on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Dependable headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are pretty solid for the price. Sound great and feel great. Not technically noise cancelling, but pretty close. Only issue I actually have is that the plastic around the headphone jack is a bit too thick and doesn't plug into my phone with the case on. I don't really mind that much as I am using these at home and my phone would just be in my pocket. Mostly, using this with my tablet anyhow.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Avila

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto
customer_reviews.text: One thing I hate about headphones, is when you are listing to music, and its loud, everyone else can hear it too, so you lower the volume, and yet people next to you can still hear it. So you keep lowering it but now the music is too low to hear correctly! Yeah these headphones don't do that. I had the music loud, and was like oh no what if everyone can hear what I am listening to, and so I took them off, and silence. That is just perfecto for me, everything else about them too is great.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Good for budget
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Sound quality is good Price is good Cons: Didn't hold up to well over time, the size adjustment doesn't hold anymore so if you adjust it then put them on it slowly slides out of adjustment. The foam on the ear cups cracked/deteriorated after about 6 months. The ear cups are uncomfortable after a long time of wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Good starter studio Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great starter studio headphones nothing crazy just solid headphones Cons for me 1)Wire is like 9 feet long if you plane to use them casually as well its a hassle but if you plan on hooking them up in a booth and leaving then its not going to be a issue 2) Ear cups are not that big so if you have big ears they feet really snug and can get annoying 3) this is just a nit pick for me but they arent crazy loud i like really loud headphone these aren't that loud they are pretty standard but they do sound nice
customer_reviews.author: Joe Demaria

customer_reviews.title: Headphones stopped working
customer_reviews.text: At first, the sound was very good, I LOVED the sound that it brought out from the music. But almost a month later, and the headphones just stopped playing back music. I'm very disappointed because I read many reviews, and ignored the ones where their sound stopped. I'm guessing that most of these defective headphones are used ones that were returned, then "fixed", then re-sold as "New". My advice is to NOT buy headphones from Amazon, period. You're better off buying headphones at your local BestBuy.
customer_reviews.author: Leo C.

customer_reviews.title: Affordable comfortable and sounds good!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these delivered today. I'm 6' 2" with a size 8 in fitted hats and this fit my head great, with no discomfort. I saw some reviews that say they are too small. I'd question if that, maybe that's more of a one off for that individual. Sounds good plugged into my Mac and the amp I have for listening to records. No complaints so far!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Oh!

customer_reviews.title: WoW did you hear it!
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased as high quality headphones as these at the price. I was so impress with them I assessed 6 pairs of headphones I own. I believe they combine a perfect mix of base and treble, highs and lows, left and right stereo, with the unbelievable clariety of following each slap of base or an emotional bending note on a guitar. There cheapest from my perspective for your listening value.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Ross

customer_reviews.title: Use Them All The Time For Mixing And Tracking Vocals
customer_reviews.text: I use this almost everyday for mixing and to acasually listen to music. Because of that I really wish it came with a shorter cable you could swap with when you dont need the extra long cable.. And because of that I took one star off. Other than that this is very reliable. The sound on these headphones are even. Not to much low end but it's there. The highs frequencys are also there but not to snappy to the point where it stings your ears. The mids are also there but not too much. If a flat set of headphones is what you looking for I do recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: TheVillainThatKilledTheSheep

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I love these headphones. My husband did a lot of research when buying his headphones and found that Audio-Technica was a well-respected brand. He loved his headphones, so when I decided to buy myself a pair, I went straight to this brand. The sound quality is great and the headphones do not hurt my ears after wearing for an hour or so. I simply with there were 2 things different about these headphones: That they were fold-able for better storage/transport and that the cord were retractable. It is my understanding that both of these features are available on more expensive models.
customer_reviews.author: PeñaRose

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing and Comfortable to wear all day.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are perfect for mixing and produce a really accurate sound without coloring too many frequencies. Plus, they're extremely comfortable right out of the box. I had a pair of sennheisers that took months to form to my head to get comfortable while these felt great straight away. I've been recently wearing them at work for 8+ hours a day 5 days a week without any real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones and Even Better Because They're Affordable
customer_reviews.text: They have amazing sound, especially for the price! I'd been needing to replace my over-the-ear headphones for decades. The poor things were literally glued together, but I didn't want to waste a lot of money on something that wasn't worth the cash. I'd tried several brands before and was always disappointed, especially when cost was factored in. Now, finally I have a pair of headphones that fit well, are comfortable, and have pretty amazing sound at a price point well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thogar

customer_reviews.title: Squeeze My Head a Bit
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are great quality. The sound is wonderful. I got these to listen to my phone and tablet with. I almost freaked out when I saw the 'microphone sized' giant plug on the end of the cord. Thankfully the giant plug had a smaller 3.5mm jack inside of it. My only complaint is that the headphone cord is incredibly long (since I only need it for my phone and tablet.) but I think I just missed that detail in the description. Plus it makes since if you're using these head phones to DJ or anything. Lol either way, I'm very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Elise

customer_reviews.title: SO TIGHT AAAHHHHH HELP
customer_reviews.text: SO EXTREMELY TIGHT If your head is larger than an orange, these will squeeze you like you owe them money Great sound quality, otherwise great. But can't use them for more than an hour at a time. They are always squeezing together, even when at rest. They are completely resistant to any kind of 'breaking in'. They will never change shape.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding affordable phones with comfortable fit - lacks detachable cord
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic audio reproduction quality, as would be expected from Audio-Technica. It delivers a truly clean and flat response so you can properly balance at the source the way you should. Don't be fooled by cheaply-made "competition" that delivers distorted low-end response at the expense of flat, across-the-spectrum fidelity. Not to mention an inflated price. The only knock here is that the M20's lack a detachable cable so you can use different lengths for different applications. I intend to use mine at my desk, so I don't mind the fixed 10 foot cord. The great thing is you get just about the same quality sound reproduction of a $100 model for half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones at a great price point.
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about these headphones except for the fact that the noise cancellation isn’t 100 percent, however I can expect that from these not being the top of the line ones. That being said, you still cancel about 90% of all sounds. These are built well, sound amazing, and have excellent control overall. I’d buy these again in a heartbeat if mine ever give out.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Siegler

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: These things are pretty damn comfortable. The sound is great for products in this price range. I like the cord too. I'm a cord guy & this one's not bad at all. It's not too stiff, doesn't stay permanently coiled or anything to really annoy an individual...the length of the cord is a logical length as well. The noise cancellation aspect of the headphones isn't what I would consider top shelf, but it dampens the background noise enough to not be a real disturbance. I like them & don't see any reason to spend any more than I did on more expensive, but similar, products.
customer_reviews.author: King Kieck

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with these headphones, especially for the price. They're not quite as flat as my Sony MDR-7506, but they don't cost quite as much either. I'd say they're a great, slightly lower cost option, or a solid back up/second pair to have around to compliment the Sonys. For comparison, to the 7506, these have heavier bass and less high end. Warmer than the 7506, and not quite as loud. High quality build, but again, not quite as solid as the Sonys. Probably the best pair of $50 headphones I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Decent pair of headphones but...
customer_reviews.text: Decent pair of headphones but sound quality and bass quality are lacking. The build quality is good and feels sturdy but the headphones are very uncomfortable. This can probably be fixed by "breaking them in." All in all, these are a nice cheap pair of headphones but I would spend a little more money to get a pair with better sound and bass. PROS: - Build Quality - Relatively Cheap CONS: - Can be uncomfortable - Sound quality lacking - Bass quality lacking
customer_reviews.author: Don Lar

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Worst piece of crap ever. Worked poorly for a month then died
customer_reviews.author: taylor taylor

customer_reviews.title: Bass heavy sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use along with a iRig HD2 to monitor my electric guitar practice. The sound was bottom heavy and weak at the high frequencies. They reminded me of the way some liked to play their stereos in the dorm rooms many years ago. If you like over emphasized bass you may like them. I returned them and bought the Sony MDR7506. Much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Malwitz

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: Nice headset, comfy for my head. I like that not only are they are the over the ear kind, but the part that sits atop the head is nicely padded too. They sound great to me, I feel like I'm getting a true sound without much coloring and the bass is just right. Not boomy or overbearing
customer_reviews.author: M. McCLaughry

customer_reviews.title: Great for daily use!
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Mids and bass are not over-pronounced. Clarity is excellent. They are super light and comfortable and sound fantastic just plugged into a MacBook Pro without any additional amplification. And best of all, I can wear these for hours on end for work, and they remain comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good for $50
customer_reviews.text: It's sound accuracy/quality is good for $50. The volume and music experience doesn't feel full though definitely lackluster in that one area but expected with . I don't have a mixer or anything like that it's plugged straight into my PC through the audio jack so something like that could make this sound better so keep that in mind. This could definitely be pretty nice if you have a mixer to boost these.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bass is not there...
customer_reviews.text: We have a 50 series of these headphones which are wonderful. They nail it in all departments. I can understand that for 20% of the money that I can't expect that quality from the same manufacturer. The highs are OK with these but there is really no low end. I was hoping for a less expensive set just for Spotify and movies on my laptop that might get me through. I wish these were the headphones but they are going back. Shame, I'm a huge fan of AT.
customer_reviews.author: Major Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 pairs of these. Great sound quality. My only problem is the same problem I have with all studio headphones, the cable is so long and obnoxious. Gets in the way. I also wish I could use them more with my phone, but I need to take off my phone case to use these. My husband has a different phone and his case needs to come off as well. But the sound quality is great! And these are great and affordable headphones for your studio.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Great setup for the money, do not be under any illusions, 100 to 200 buys an even better set. For me personally they perform awesome. Not quite as comfy as expected but very good sound isolation. To the individuals crowing about volume not going high enough "You arent doing your ears any favors blasting music at full tilt" Give me a break people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these so I could relax and to prevent me from waking up family members. I tend to get up earlier than everyone else so I don't want to wake them. I like the over the ear type better than in the ear. They feel comfortable and have good sound, plus the cable is pretty long. I think I might upgrade to the next model to get the detachable cable though. Still a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Staats

customer_reviews.title: Too Uncomfortable on My Ears and Head.
customer_reviews.text: The price was fair. They are well made the quality is there. What spoils it for me, in spite of the other reviews to the contrary, is that they ARE NOT comfortable on my ears. Within a very brief time frame I feel pressure, discomfort and too much warmth on my ears. This cannot be adjusted because it is because the ear pads are not large enough to surround the ear but rather touch the ear and thus put pressure on them. Had I known this up front I would not have bought them
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Linda S.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice all-around pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a nice headphone set. The cable is long enough to allow me to record and play guitar and isolate sounds as needed. The sound quality is pretty good and I would buy them again and recommend them for anyone looking for a pair of general use headphones at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: sousa is cool

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound & Comfort / Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I had a set of cheap Koss headphones that I used for like a decade that finally died. Decided I wanted to replace them with something a little nicer but didn't want to break the bank. These ATH-M20x's have impressive sound and are super comfortable to wear. If I would complain about anything it's that the cable is GIGANTIC. Though, seeing as these are intended more for studio work, i can understand why the cable is so long. Overall - fantastic buy. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Partridge

customer_reviews.title: Audio purest, standard headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, these are very good standard headphones. No extra base, no noise canceling, no removable wires. They are very good sound and quality for the $50 price tag. The defining characteristic is that these are made for people who want to hear everything in their music. A really clean digital recording of a studio-created song, or the scratches and imperfections of a record transfered to digital media. You will hear everything in your music.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Not suite for large ears
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great, My biggest problem with these is the earpads and headphones themselves are small they will not fit you if you have large ears. They do not fit me, my ears fit in the earcups but definitely not as comfortable as I’d like them to. This may be related to the headphones being small but I can hear my voice vibrate as If I were wearing earbuds if you ever wore in ear earbuds you know how they plug your ear canals and you can feel and hear your voice vibrate this is really annoying to me. I will be returning, Like I said though the sound quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality. I'm using them for electronic drums mostly and the frequency response is outstanding. They're really comfortable and completely cover your ears to block out ambient noise. The long cord is great for my purposes. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: RLMiller

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I love these headphone, for the price they honestly do a great job. I watched some YouTube reviews on this specific headphone and I will say don’t worry too much about the nit picky YouTube reviewers, get these headphones because I use them for recording vocals and when recording vocals you don’t want too much sound bleeding into the mic which can mess up your takes and these headphones are great for recording vocals and they don’t really bleed that much even at high volumes but to be realistic if you’re blasting these you will obviously here noise but other than that I recommend getting these, they do the job really well.
customer_reviews.author: Salis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and good at cutting out external noise
customer_reviews.text: I tried a lot of different headphones before I settled on these. I like the fact the ears are oval (not circular) and actually accommodate the shape of a normal person's ear. They are comfortable, cut out external noise well, and provide acceptable audio quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: VitaminJ

customer_reviews.title: Very nice entry level headphone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice entry level headphones. I have the M50's, and they compare well. I purchased these for my brother who has never owned studio headphones, and he was very pleased with them. These are probably not going to be as well received by true audiophiles, but for the price, you can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Donald D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is our third pair of Audio-Technica headphones. We only trust this brand because of the high quality at a decent price. We've tried other brands, but they didn't last long at all. Each of our Audio-Technica headphones lasted well over two years before showing any real signs of wear and tear. My wife is still on her original headphones, which she bought nearly three years ago. These headphones are very comfortable, there is no feedback or buzzing sound, as with some other headphones, the cord is long, but doesn't tangle easily, our ears don't sweat, as with some other brands, and the ear cushioning does not crack easily. Well worth the price. We're sticking with Audio-Technica!
customer_reviews.author: cattytux

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I use these while editing my podcasts. They sound great, very clear, and the fit is tremendous. No fatigue from wearing them, and they are just great comfortable headphones. The cord is not only long but seems to be a better quality than some old Sennheisers that I have, though they're great too.
customer_reviews.author: whoyouthink

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The Audio-Technica ATH-M20x is definitely one of my favorite headphones. Now, working at home, with the kids playing around, I love to put this headphones on and listen some soft music to be able to concentrate. The sound quality is superb and they are very comfortable to use for a long period.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound/Low price
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation and sound quality are outstanding. I control the volume with my computer so I didnt evaluate it. I didnt know it had a volume control. I just plugged the set into my computer and ran it. Simple, low cost. A real bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf

customer_reviews.title: A good set of headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are very good headphones with excellent clarity of sound reproduction. I can't get more specific than that. They aren't skewed toward base or treble but deliver both well. I find the ear pads not as soft some I've previously owned and they just barely qualify as over the ear vs on the ear coverage. But they are comfortable and acceptable. The cord is long and non detachable. It comes with a 3.5mm plug and the larger plug adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Picked these as a travel set for the teenager on road trips. Comfy ear cups, over the ear design cuts out the car radio enough that he can jam to his own tunes without whining about what everyone else is listening to. Can't vouch for "audiophile quality" since after 30 years of flying I don't have those ears, but they sounded great to me. Best $30 I've spent in a long time!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Run away. These do not last.
customer_reviews.text: Went to waste bin. You get what you paid for. A rip off. Reason: three month of use and ear padding cracked and became very rigid and uncomfortable. Phone were living horrible red marks on ears. Run away. These do not last.
customer_reviews.author: 12review

customer_reviews.title: For the money you can't do better!
customer_reviews.text: If you are comfortable with using headphones...these are amazing. A nice big sound stage, brilliant detail. Bass is good, could be a touch better but it is very well balanced. They are fairly and not to cumbersome when on my head. I would buy this model again...or with as good as these are I'd see what the higher levels bring to the table. They are like having my home theater at work.
customer_reviews.author: MattyMo76

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive . . . Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this based upon the great comments and high ratings. However, It performs far below my expectations. I listen to all kinds of music and they all sound so lackluster with this headphone. It doesn’t produce the rich bass and brilliant highs. It’s mostly mid-range. I should have stuck with Sennheiser which was very impressive at a comparable price.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones for the price. I waited at least eight months before I wrote this review, and I have to say that these headphones do the job. If you think you’re somehow going to get the perfect recording just by using headphones, you’re out of your mind. These give you some good clarity from mixing and I recommend using many different listening platforms to get the right balance in a song
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Rice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality at this price point.
customer_reviews.text: Durable construction, excellent sound quality, and a comfortable fit. Noise cancellation is 'average'; not an active system but they do cover and surround the entire ear which deadens outside noise effectively. Sound quality is very good, with deep rich bass and only minor high frequency distortion when played loud which is excellent for a single-driver headphone. Comfort is great, possibly a touch too heavy for my tastes, but well cushioned on the head and ears which is good enough for you to forget you are wearing them after a while. Overall I'd definitely recommend these to people looking to make a purchase at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Transcribing Recordings
customer_reviews.text: I transcribe recordings and was having problems hearing some of the people on the recordings. I purchased these because the price was right and they are broadcast quality. Now, I don't have any problems hearing all of the people on the recordings and I have been able transcribe with ease and efficiency.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not the best sound for professional studio use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones for my studio after my last pair of headphones had a shortage in them. I wish I did my research before I bought them. If I did, I would have spent the extra $50 to buy the m40x version. I just ordered the m40x version and after they arrive I’ll do a review on them too. In conclusion, these are not ideal for professional studio use as far as sound.
customer_reviews.author: Judah

customer_reviews.title: Great for practicing
customer_reviews.text: I use these to practice at home. With 7 people living here and especially in quarantine and Wei other people working nightshifts, this is basically a MUST These are great, they’re comfortable, they don’t have any added bass or anything. They cancel out a good amount of noise but not block out all noise completely. I’d recommend to someone who’s looking for some headphones to practice with 👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: omar

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are an amazing value. I've used recording microphones by Audio-Technica in the past that I really liked, so I had high expectations for their headphones. I was not disappointed. They are crisp and clear in mid and hi and still have supple and accurate lows. Great all around headphone for music, gaming, cinema, tracking, etc. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for accurate studio quality headphones for under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra Warren

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: For the $$ this is a great set of phones. I'm using for in home collaborations with band mates and its perfect for my budget and the job it needs to do. The long cable is great, I can put my phone much further away to record my part. The in mic earbuds that came with my iPhone created scratching when it moved...so no more re recording my parts. sounds great just listening to streaming tunes as well. So far far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: PeterM

customer_reviews.title: Defective manufacture?
customer_reviews.text: I intended to use the earphones connected to a computer and/or keyboard as I practiced my music lessons. The phones appear to be well made and comfortable to wear, but the volume of the sound in the earphone without the connecting wire is 1/4 of the volume of the one with the wire. I find that very annoying and disappointing. I am returning them and exchanging them for the same product. Perhaps it was just a lemon. I'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund J. Vallecorse

customer_reviews.title: My favorite
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite headphone Ive had And I’ve tried many. I get headaches easily and most headphones give me headaches really fast but I can wear these for a good while before I notice any discomfort. Definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone beginners and professionals
customer_reviews.text: These have worked perfectly with so many projects, I've used them with my mac book pro and the blue mic and I've been able to create some great voice overs, podcasts and edit audio in a room full of people. That says a lot for a journalist trying to meet a deadline without interruption. So comfortable wearing on those long editing days. Clear and crisp sound quality, especially when editing in layers. Great for any professional.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight... almost feels like you're going to break them everytime you go to put them on, but for $60 it's not bad. Also if you're getting these for gaming I'd just recommend getting the corsair HS50's or HS60s.. they lasted me about 2 years, way better quality than these and they are I believe either open back or like semi open back so they don't put pressure on your ears like these do
customer_reviews.author: Corey

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica ATH-M20x Professional Studio Monitor Headphones, Black
product_meta.description:
Style:Single

The ATH M20x professional monitor headphones are a great introduction to the critically acclaimed M Series line. Modern design and high quality materials combine to deliver a comfortable listening experience, with enhanced audio and effective isolation. An excellent choice for tracking and mixing. 

More About the M Series Headphones Critically acclaimed M Series professional monitor headphones deliver accurate audio and outstanding comfort, perfect for long sessions in the studio and on the go. Contoured earcups seal tight for excellent sound isolation, with minimal bleed. And the pro grade materials are durable, yet comfortable. Find out why online reviewers, top audio engineers, and cult followers agree, M Series is an unmatched combination of audio and build quality that gets the job done. Hour after hour, year after year.

Cable Length: 9.8' / 2.99 m.
feature_bullets: Advanced build quality and engineering; Designed for studio tracking and mixing
40 millimeter drivers with rare earth magnets and copper clad aluminum wire voice coils
Tune for enhanced low frequency performance
Circumaural design contours around the ears for excellent sound isolation in loud environments
Convenient single side cable exit; Magnet neodymium; Designed for studio tracking and mixing

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,846 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
